The Next Five Years in the Appliances and Electronics Manufacturing Industry

Trends in tech, energy efficiency, sustainability, automation, customization & online sales drive growth in Electronics Industry. Success depends on adapting to these trends.

Razi Alakhdar - Marketing Manager
21 Mar 2023
  • Share on LinkedIn
  • Share on Twitter
  • Share on Facebook

Table of Contents

The Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry has experienced significant growth in recent years, and this trend is expected to continue over the next five years. The rapid advancements in technology and the increasing demand for innovative, energy-efficient products have driven the growth of this industry.

In this article, we will examine the trends and drivers that will shape the industry in the next five years.

The Future of Home Living: Smart Homes

The integration of smart home technology is a significant trend in the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry, shaping the industry in the coming years. Consumers increasingly look for products that can be remotely operated and monitored, including appliances like refrigerators, ovens, and lighting systems controlled through a smartphone app.

As smart home technology evolves, we can expect even more integration with products like Amazon Alexa and Google Home voice-activated assistants. With smart home technology, consumers have more control over their homes, allowing for better energy management, cost savings, and reduced carbon footprints.

Smart home technology has significant advantages for consumers, including increased security and improved home automation. As technology advances, we can expect even more benefits, such as more efficient energy consumption and improved convenience in our daily lives.

The Growing Demand for Energy-Efficient Appliances

Consumers are increasingly prioritizing energy efficiency due to the rising awareness of environmental issues. The demand for energy-efficient appliances and electronics is expected to grow significantly over the next five years. Manufacturers have already taken action to meet the needs of certain regions where only EnergyStar certified appliances and LED lighting are available for purchase.

As technology improves, the cost of producing energy-efficient products is decreasing, making them more accessible to consumers. With the increasing demand for energy-efficient products and the cost of production going down, we can expect to see a significant increase in the availability and affordability of energy-efficient appliances and electronics in the coming years.

Clean Air and Water: A Growing Concern for Consumers

As consumers prioritize their health and wellness, the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is developing products to cater to their needs. Air purifiers and water filters are becoming increasingly popular as they help eliminate pollutants and contaminants from indoor environments, providing cleaner and safer air and water for consumers.

This trend is expected to continue with the development of even more products that prioritize the health and well-being of consumers. For instance, the market can expect smart home systems that monitor and enhance air quality, along with an increase in water filtration systems. Manufacturers that fulfill the growing demand for health and wellness products will be at an advantageous position to succeed in the industry.

The Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is seeing a boost in product development that benefits consumers' health and wellness. Consumers will continue to seek out products that align with their values, and manufacturers will continue to innovate to meet their needs.

Robotics and Automation Revolutionize Manufacturing

The use of robotics and automation in the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is a growing trend. The benefits of automation include improved production speed and quality while reducing costs. Manufacturers are using robots for various tasks in manufacturing, such as assembling components, painting, and quality control. Robotic automation has the potential to revolutionize the manufacturing process, reducing labor costs and improving efficiency.

In the home, automation is becoming increasingly popular, with products such as robotic vacuums and lawnmowers simplifying daily tasks. Smart home technology allows for remote control of these devices from a smartphone, making them even more convenient. The use of automation in the home is expected to increase over the next five years as more consumers seek ways to simplify their lives.

As the demand for automated products and services increases, we can expect further advancements in this area. The use of automation is not limited to manufacturing and the home but is expanding to other sectors, such as healthcare and transportation. The growth of automation in the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is driving innovation and growth in other industries, leading to a more efficient and connected world.

The Trend Towards Customization and Visualization

The trend towards customization has become increasingly popular in the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry, with more and more companies offering personalized products. The introduction of 3D product configurators has enabled consumers to design their own products and select specific features that meet their individual needs. This trend is expected to continue to grow over the next five years, with an increasing number of companies offering customized products to meet the specific needs of their customers.

The use of 3D product configurators has helped to increase customer engagement and satisfaction. Consumers can now select specific features that meet their individual needs and preferences, creating a more personalized and enhanced shopping experience. Customization also provides companies with a competitive advantage by offering unique products that meet the specific needs of their customers.

Over the next five years, we can expect to see an increasing number of companies offering customized products in response to the growing trend towards personalization. Companies that can successfully incorporate customization into their product offerings will be well-positioned for success in the future. As technology continues to advance, we can expect to see even more sophisticated customization tools that will allow consumers to design and personalize their products in new and innovative ways.

Eco-Friendly: A Renewed Focus on Sustainability

There is a renewed focus on sustainability in the home appliance industry, with companies now striving to be carbon-neutral in their operations and products. This new trend has resulted in Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) becoming a crucial deciding factor for consumers. Businesses are now creating products that are both environmentally sustainable and offer enhanced benefits for the users, compared to previous offerings.

The focus on sustainability in the home appliance industry has been ongoing, and the introduction of products like the Samsung SmartThings Energy Service is evidence of this. The service enables users to monitor and track their energy consumption and make adjustments to reduce their carbon footprint. With the continued emphasis on sustainability, it is likely that the market will see an increase in the number of products that promote energy efficiency and environmental responsibility. This increase in offerings is a result of the growing focus and investment in sustainability by businesses in the industry.

The continued emphasis on sustainability in the home appliance industry is beneficial for both consumers and the environment. This focus has resulted in the creation of eco-friendly products that help reduce energy consumption and carbon emissions. The use of such products not only benefits the environment but also provides consumers with cost savings and a sense of environmental responsibility.

The Shift From Gas to Electric and Induction Cooking

As controversy surrounds the use of natural gas in new constructions, with several states enacting legislation regarding piping natural gas to residential and commercial buildings, consumers are increasingly gravitating toward induction cooking. Induction are becoming more popular in the long run, and the trend is expected to continue over the next five years.

Induction is the most efficient type of cooking and more so than gas, traditional electric, or vitroceramic., as it only heats the cookware and not the surrounding air. This leads to reduced energy consumption and lower utility bills, making induction cooking a cost-effective and environmentally friendly alternative to gas. Moreover, induction hobs heat up faster and are easier to clean than traditional gas hobs, making them a more convenient option for consumers.

The growing concern for the environment among consumers and the desire to reduce their carbon footprint is driving an increase in demand for electric and induction cooking. This trend has created an opportunity for manufacturers to offer more energy-efficient products and gain a larger market share. Additionally, with the well-publicized health risks associated with gas cooking, including exposure to CO2 and methane, consumers are becoming more aware of the benefits of using electric and induction cooking methods.

Omnichannel and D2C Sales Are Trending

Omnichannel and D2C sales are on the rise in the major appliance industry. With online sales surpassing traditional retail locations, companies are leveraging eCommerce platforms to simplify the buying experience. They are providing free shipping, flexible consumer credit, and no-questions-asked returns to attract customers.

To expand their product offerings, these companies are collaborating with retail chains. Alibaba and Pinduoduo are leading the way in China, with Pinduoduo acquiring a 5.6% stake in Gome. Appliance manufacturers are also adopting new marketing strategies, such as live streaming, to promote and sell their products.

The shift towards online sales has allowed businesses to reach a larger customer base, and provide them with more buying options. It has also given customers the flexibility to make purchases from anywhere, anytime. As companies continue to embrace omnichannel and D2C sales, we can expect to see more major appliance companies adopting these strategies to meet customer needs.

Organic Electronics: The Sustainable Future of Tech

Organic electronics, such as semiconductors made out of organic compounds, are growing in popularity. For context, the organic electronics market, valued at $66.19 billion in 2021, is expected to reach $405.12 billion by 2030 at a CAGR of 22.30% from 2022-2030.

Compared to conventional inorganic electronics, these organically made products offer many advantages. They have low power consumption, are cost-effective, flexible, indissoluble, and optically transparent. Additionally, manufacturers' preference for organic electronics is driven by the rise in awareness of sustainable development and environmentally friendly production.

Using organic materials in producing electronic devices permits the use of safer, less readily accessible raw materials by electronics manufacturers. As a result, it gives businesses new opportunities, undoubtedly offering them a competitive edge.

The Future is Bright for Electrical Manufacturing

The Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is poised for significant growth in the coming years, driven by various trends such as sustainability, health and wellness, and smart home integration. As consumers demand more eco-friendly and energy-efficient products, companies that prioritize these factors will have a competitive edge.

In addition, the rise of robotics, automation, and new technologies such as AI will revolutionize the manufacturing process and enhance efficiency. Companies that can adapt to these changes will be at the forefront of innovation and growth.

The emphasis on customization and personalization is another factor that will shape the industry in the coming years. As consumers look for products that suit their individual needs and preferences, companies that can offer customized solutions will be well-positioned for success.

Overall, the Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Industry is set to experience significant growth in the next five years, driven by a combination of consumer demands and technological innovations. Companies that can embrace these changes and stay ahead of the trends will be in a strong position to succeed.
